forecasting.name: Forecasting Consumer Loans
forecasting.description: Built a forecast of aggregate revolving US consumer loans as part of my final project report for my Time Series Econometrics class. Applied data cleaning to raw macroeconomic time series, conducted model selection, and employed multiple exogenous variables to construct a SARIMAX (Seasonal AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average with eXogenous regressors) model. Later evaluated the model's prediction against the next released data point.

vi.name: Variational Inference Project
vi.description: Wrote a paper detailining the mathematical foundations of variational inference and applied VI to a sample problem on synthetic data. Submitted the report as my final project for my Bayesian Statistics class.

rainforest.name: Ecommerce Website
rainforest.description: Built a full-stack ecommerce website as part of a team final project for my Databases Systems class. Designed a relational database schema, implemented the database in PostgreSQL, and built a web application using Flask and SQLAlchemy. I walk through my main contributions to the project in the first three minutes of the demo video linked below.

datathon.name: Oil Datathon
datathon.description: Selected to participate in the spring 2024 Citadel Invitation Datathon. Worked in a team to conduct an analysis on the relationship between county-level dependence on the oil/gas industry and various socioeconomic outcomes. Implemented a Generalized Estimation Equations (GEE) model to distinguish a reation between patterns of oil income and long-term county-level income growth. Found a relationship between certian public opinion questions and county-level oil/gas industry dependence after accounting for political partisanship.

profitProphet.name: Profit Prophet
profitProphet.description: A data-driven stock prediction game designed to help build interest in the financial markets by interpreting the effect of news headlines on historical stock prices.

elucidate.name: Elucidate Chrome Extension
elucidate.description: Built a Chrome Extension to convert the reading level and/or language of highlighted text in place. Won Education Track, Peopleâ€™s Choice Award at Duke Generative AI Hackathon.

geo.name: AI GeoGuessr Clone
geo.description: Built an AI-enabled GeoGuessr clone as part of team project for ECE 489: System Design for Machine Learning class (See Demo). Responsible for most of front-end and game logic implemented using React JS, Google Maps API, and Tailwind. (See GitHub)

clustering.name: Interactive Clustering Simulator
clustering.description: Built an interactive clustering visualizer which implements k-means and DBSCAN (density-based spatial clustering of applications with noise). Used paper.js for canvas graphics.

math585.name: Algorithmic Trading Project
math585.description: Submitted linked report as final group project for Math 585: Intro to Algorithmic Trading. As a team, developed an algorithm involving an options dispersion and pairs trading strategy with pairs selected through UMAP. I was largely responsible for capital allocation between strategies for which I determined optimal portfolio weights through regularized convex optimization via the PyPortfolioOpt library.

ece684_project.name: Election Prediction with NLP
ece684_project.description: Built models to predict 2020 county-level election outcomes via Covid-related excerpts from local news. Submitted as final class project for ECE 684, Natural Language Processing.

eceRISC.name: ECE 651 Class Project: RISC
eceRISC.description: Built a board game similar to Risk as part of several-week team project for ECE 651: Software Engineering (See Demo). Game allows multiplayer through remote server, UI implemented in JavaFX. (See GitLab)

cs671.name: CS 671 Kaggle Competition
cs671.description: Built classifier (See Report) to predict employee attrition for CS 671 (Graduate Machine Learning) Kaggle Competition. Conducted feature engineering, exploratory data analysis via PCA, TSNE, UMAP algorithms, built XGBoost, AdaBoost, Logistic Regression models. Placed 6/145 in class of Ph.D., masters, and undergraduate students on public leaderboard by model accuracy.

digit.name: Spoken Digit Classification
digit.description: Built a series of maximum likelihood models to classify spoken Arabic Digits using Cepstral Coefficients (see slides in GitHub repository). Achieved 84% accuracy on test set using k-means maximum likelihood classifier, and 96% using a Gaussian Mixture Model. Submitted as a class project for ECE 480, Applied Probability for Statistical Learning.

customer2.name: RFM Customer Analysis
customer2.description: Conducted customer segmentation (See Presentation), recency, frequency, monetary (RFM) analysis on Online Retail II Dataset. Determined factors strongly associated with high-value customers. Built XGBoost model with 90.8% accuracy, 0.97 AUC, to predict whether customer will make purchase in next 90 days.

thisWebsite.name: This Website
thisWebsite.description: I recently rebult my personal website in Next.js and React. Feel free to check out the repo!

eog.name: EOG Independent Study
eog.description: Designed and breadboarded an EOG (electrooculography) acquisition circuit as part of my independent study in Spring 2022. The circuit may be used to track gaze through a series of electrodes around subject's eyes. This design includes a driven right leg circuit in order to reduce the high common-mode interference of the EOG signals.

swervePong.name: SwervePong Game
swervePong.description: Made a pong game with few additional features using JS, HTML Canvas, and CSS.

diig.name: DIIG Example Deliverable
diig.description: This is a portion of the final deliverable for my Spring 2021 DIIG (Duke Impact Investing Group) Project. That semester, I conducted data analysis for a housing startup along with a small team. These slides consist of my portion of the originally larger slide deck, and were presented to individuals within the startup. I completed all analysis shown in the slides.

customer1.name: Customer Analysis
customer1.description: This is a slide deck I presented Spring semester 2021 for a club's onboarding process. I used this deck to present the results of my data analysis on a mock data set of customer histories for a credit card company.

egr1.name: Solar Panel Soiling Sensor
egr1.description: This is the result of my final project for my Introduction to Engineering Class. I worked in a team of four to solve a design problem given to us by an outside client. Our project was to design a soiling sensor, which detected the loss of efficiency of solar panels due to dust/accumulated debris.
